message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a novel model for point cloud semantic segmentation, which involves exploiting both local and global structures within the point cloud based on contextual point representations. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories, as it involves developing a model for image analysis and classification. Additionally, the use of contextual point representations suggests that the paper may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category, as it involves developing a model that can reason about complex relationships between different points in a point cloud. The use of graph attention blocks and attention strategies also suggests that the paper may belong to the graphics (cs.GR) sub-category, as it involves developing a model that can dynamically compose and update point representations within a local point cloud structure. Finally, the use of spatial-wise and channel-wise attention strategies suggests that the paper may also belong to the natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-category, as attention mechanisms are commonly used in language models to selectively focus on different parts of a sentence or document.
